data: We present the result of a search of the Milagro sky map for spatial correlations with sources from a subset of the recent Fermi Bright Source List (BSL). The BSL consists of the 205 most significant sources detected above 100 MeV by the Fermi Large Area Telescope. We select sources based on their categorization in the BSL, taking all confirmed or possible Galactic sources in the field of view of Milagro. Of the 34 Fermi sources selected, 14 are observed by Milagro at a significance of 3 standard deviations or more. We conduct this search with a new analysis which employs newly optimized gamma-hadron separation and utilizes the full eight-year Milagro data set. Milagro is sensitive to gamma rays with energy from 1 to 100 TeV with a peak sensitivity from 10 to 50 TeV depending on the source spectrum and declination. These results extend the observation of these sources far above the Fermi energy band. With …
Milagro observations of multi-TeV emission from Galactic sources in the Fermi bright source list

AA Abdo and BT Allen and T Aune and D Berley and C Chen and GE Christopher and T DeYoung and BL Dingus and RW Ellsworth and MM Gonzalez and JA Goodman and E Hays and CM Hoffman and PH Hüntemeyer and BE Kolterman and JT Linnemann and JE McEnery and T Morgan and AI Mincer and P Nemethy and J Pretz and JM Ryan and PM Saz Parkinson and A Shoup and G Sinnis and AJ Smith and V Vasileiou and GP Walker and DA Williams and GB Yodh
